episode_summary: This episode features discussions on the Maillard reaction and its surprising connection to fake tan, Japan's discovery of thousands of previously unrecognized islands, the impact of urban versus rural upbringing on navigational skills, and an inventive gun that shoots tears back at the person who made you cry. The hosts also share personal anecdotes and humorous insights related to these topics.

facts.fact: The Maillard reaction, the thing that makes your bread turn brown when you toast it, is actually the same thing that makes fake tan work.
Japan's just found 7,000 islands that it didn't know it had.
If you grew up in a city, then you have a worse sense of direction than someone born in the countryside, though it doesn't seem to work if you're from Hungary.
An inventor called Yifei Chen has designed a gun which collects tears from your face so you can shoot them back at the person who made you cry.
